topic.domains: (topic hi-d) (topic ut-d) (topic indexing-d) (topic hazard-d) (topic abbrev-d) (topic pr-d) (topic sw-d) (topic ui-d) (topic struct-d) (topic firmware-d) (topic pmcrevhis-d) a(props sp-version) a(props pmc_switch) a(props pmc_package) a(props pmc_phy) a(props ddr-width) a(props package) a(props fw_package) a(props pcie-drive-ports ) a(props pcie-host-ports) a(props raid-support ) a(props sas-ports ) a(props media) a(props component)
topic.title: OTN Runtime API

body.p: The following API are OTN Runtime API and are described in this section. Specific parameters of the API described below are referenced throughout the LINEOTN, COREOTN and MAPOTN Subsystem functional descriptions.

entry.p: Sets the FEC mode for the specified OTN channel.
Configures the transmit Trail Trace Identifier(TTI) field of the specified SM/PM/TTI layer
Sets the payload type field of the OPU layer framer channel
Configures the transmit or receive Expected Multiplex Structure Identifier(MSI) based on the direction parameter
Special configuration that enables the retrieval on unused tributary slots for partially filled High Order
Configures the source of the backward indicator fields
Configures the forced Backward Defect Indicator (BDI) or the Backward Error Indicator (BEI)/BIAE fields for a framer channel on the specified PM or TCM layer
Configures the transmitted 3-bit status (STAT) overhead field.
Sets the Transmit Fault Type & Fault Location(FTFL) overhead field of an ODUk framer channel.
Sets the Transmit Automatic Protection Switching(APS) overhead field of an ODUCn/ODUk framer channel.
Sets the Transmit Experimental(EXP) overhead field of an ODUk framer channel.
Sets the Transmit Tandem Connection Monitor Activation/Deactivation Control Channel(TCM_ACT) overhead field of an ODUk framer channel.
Sets the GCC OH fields for the specified OTN channel.
Sets the Reserved for future international standardization(RES) OH fields for the specified OTN channel.
Sets the OSMC OH fields for the specified OTN channel.
Used to insert the inverted BIP-8 value into the PM BIP-8 and any operational TCMi BIP-8 Overhead field of the ODUk channel
Sets the device as a delay measure source or in feed through mode.
Starts a delay measure that was previously set up via the g5_api_otn_delay_measure_set() API.
Sets the dTIM detection mode for an OTU or ODU framer channel in the sink position.
Enables or disables consequential action generation on an OTU4, OTU4+, or OTUCn channel when one or more defect is detected on the OTU layer of the incoming stream.
Enables or disables consequential action generation on an OTU4, OTU4+, or OTUCn channel when one or more defect is detected on the OTU layer of the incoming stream.
Enables or disables consequential action generation on ODUP or ODUT layer of an ODUk channel upon detection of a defect.
Sets MI_LTCAct_Enable as defined in G.798. This function enables or disables consequential action generation on a selected TCM layer of an ODUk channel upon detection of dLTC.
Sets MI_TIMActDis as defined in G.798. This function enables or disables consequential action generation on ODUP or ODUT layer of an ODUk channel upon detection of dTIM.
Enables or disables aAIS consequential action on an operational TCM layer of an ODUk channel to be generated downstream to ODUP layer.
Enables or disables consequential action generation on an ODUk channel upon detection of a selected defect.
Enables or disables consequential action generation on an ODUCn channel upon detection of a selected defect being present on one or more of its member ODUC channel.

Enables or disables SSF generation upon dMSIM detection on all ODUk channels of the selected ODU framer stage. The setting selected in this function will apply to all ODUk channels within he ODUk framer. Per tributary port selection for dMSIM to SSF control in ODTUjk is not supported.

Forces an IAE into the ODU overhead of all operational TCM layers provisioned on the ODUk channel. When IAE is forced, a '010' pattern will be inserted in the TCM STAT overhead field for 16 multi-frames
Is used to enable or disable the automatic insertion of IAE into the STAT overhead field of all operational TCM layers of the ODUk channel.

Inserts or removes a maintenance signal on an OTUk, ODUP, or ODUT layer. This function is used to force a maintenance signal on transmit data stream or receive data stream. In order to remove a maintenance signal, call this function with enable set to FALSE.
Inserts or removes a NULL signal on the OPU payload in transmit direction.
Configures OPU-CSF bit on the OPU overhead. When OPU-CSF bit set to be enabled, it will write 1 to the OPU-CSF bit of the PSI byte[2] to indicate the signal fail status of the client.

Configures an OTUk or an OTUCn channel in pass through mode in sink or source direction. This function is used for LINEOTN or SYSOTN channels. When an OTUCn channel is configured in pass through mode, all OTUC member of the OTUCn group will be in pass through mode.
Enables insertion/extract of GCC0, GCC1, or GCC2 fields between the framer referenced by the channel and the GCC port identified by the framer type.
Enables or disables the OHP extraction and/or insertion mask for a particular channel.
Enables or disables the PRBS function mapped into an ODUk.
Configures the defect threshold count for the given PRBS channel.
Used for PRBS single error insertion.
Enables and disables the LINEOTN or SYSOTN Bit Error Generator on 32-bit interfaces (BERGEN32).
Enables or disables BIP8/BEI/BIAE/IAE/BDI/MFAS overhead insertion in OTU layer.
Configures the dDEG detection mode: hardware calculation or firmware calculation.
Configures the dDEG detection mode: hardware calculation or firmware calculation.
Returns the complete channel configuration information for the chnl_id specified.
Returns the complete channel configuration information for the chnl_id specified.
Returns the current FEC mode setting for the specified High Order OTN channel id and the error rate percentage.

section.title: g5_api_otn_fec_mode_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_fec_mode_set() API sets the FEC mode for the specified OTN channel. The FEC mode is set on the OTU channel referenced from the channel id used in the g5_api_otn_prov() API. The FEC operation applies to G-FEC as defined in the G.709 standard. FEC can be either disabled, or enabled. If the latter then the it can be enabled to pass the FEC through untouched or perform FEC error correction. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the High Order OTN channel that was provisioned with the g5_api_otn_prov() API.
The mode parameter of the g5_api_otn_fec_mode_set() API and is defined by the enumeration g5_otn_fec_mode_t. The mode choices are shown in Table 2 below.

entry.p: FEC is disabled and no processing is done.
FEC is enabled and any forward correction done in the FEC correction module is performed.
FEC is enabled and it is simply passed through with no FEC correction made.

In a restart case specifying this value results in the channel retaining its current FEC value without having to specify the value. On a cold startup or new channel provisioning this value has the same affect as G5_OTN_FEC_MODE_NONE

section.title: g5_api_otn_tti_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tti_set() API configures the transmit Trail Trace Identifier(TTI) field of the specified SM/PM/TTI layer. This API is used for the source direction (transmit) or sink (receive Expected) and for all possible stages and framing layers. The 32 bytes of the tti_dataN parameter are broken into: 0-15 SAPI Bytes and 16-31 DAPI Bytes or 0-31 Operator Specific. Note that this API assumes that a TCM pool ID has been created for the SM/PM/TCM layer parameter. It also assumes that is the layer is OPERATIONAL otherwise an error would be returned. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID representing the ODU framer channel being set.

The layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_tti_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the different SM/PM/TCM1-6 overhead field layers used in an OTN channel. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 below.

entry.p: PM field related to ODUCn segments.

section.p: The direction parameter of the g5_api_otn_tti_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_direction_t that represents the direction being set. The direction choices are shown in Table 4 below.

entry.p: Sink applies to the receive direction which is defined as either receive Accept read-only field or Expect read-write field. Does not apply to all OH fields Applies in some cases to one or the other and for others applies to both.
Transmit Source based direction applies only.
Handles both direction where applicable. For example can be used to configure transmit and Expected sink direction.

section.p: The fabric_framer_flag parameter used when the chnl_id refers to a segment with two framer stages (and is ignored otherwise): When set to TRUE, the Stage 3B or Stage 4 framers to/from the fabric which are appropriate for the segment are selected. When set to FALSE the Stage1/2/3A/N framer is selected. The following segments have multiple framer stages:

li.p: LINEOTN OEO and SYSOTN OEO: OTUCN_GROUP_SEGMENT

section.p: The tti_data_ptr parameter is a pointer to the 64 bytes of TTI data containing SAPI/DAPI/OPSPEC fields.

section.title: g5_api_otn_pt_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_pt_set() API sets the payload type field of the OPU layer framer channel based on the specified direction. Source sets the transmit field while Sink sets the receive Expected field of the payload type. The PT field is initialized to 0xFF if the channel is in passthrough mode. Values other than 0xFF in PT field can be used to determined if the PT field has been Accepted since the last initialization. Note that G.709 "Table 15-9 - Payload type code points" dictates that PT should change when inserting NULL frame or PRBS. Note, that the SDK does not modify the transmit and receive PT values when inserting PRBS or NULL frame via the PRBS and NULL AP, therefore setting the transmit and receive PT values with this API is required. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID identifying the OPU framer channel.
The direction parameter of the g5_api_otn_tti_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_direction_t that represents the direction being set. The direction choices are shown in Table 4 above.
The value parameter of the g5_api_otn_pt_set() API is the 1 byte payload type value,PSI[0].

section.title: g5_api_otn_msi_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_msi_set() API configures the transmit or receive Expected Multiplex Structure Identifier(MSI) based on the direction parameter. Configuration occurs for the tributary slots used by the OPU layer of the framer channel. For transmit (source) direction, this is valid only for High Order or Mid Order channelized ODU channels. This is not valid for unchannelized Low Order or Mid Order ODU channels. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID identifying the OPU framer channel.
The direction parameter of the g5_api_otn_tti_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_direction_t that represents the direction being set. The direction choices are shown in Table 4 above.
The trib_slot parameter specifics the tributary port of a High Order or Mid Order channel whose MSI value to be updated. The valid range for trib_slot is as follows:
The value parameter of the g5_api_otn_msi_set() API is the MSI byte for the specified tributary slot.

section.title: g5_api_otn_rx_partial_ho_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_rx_partial_ho_set() API is a special configuration that enables the retrieval on unused tributary slots for partially filled High Order ODU. This should be called prior to the g5_api_otn_rx_msi_get() API to avoid waiting for the MSI acceptance process. This API applies only to ODUjk de-multiplexing and does not apply to ODUCn de-multiplexing. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID identifying the OPU framer channel.

The accept_msi parameter chooses if the unused timeslots have the MSI accepted. When set to TRUE, the de-multiplexer is configured to accept MSI on unused tributary slots. When set to FALSE, the de-multiplexer is configured to not accept MSI on unused tributary slots. When set to TRUE, the wait time for MSI acceptance is as follows for the following ODUk rates:

section.title: g5_api_otn_bkwd_ind_src_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_bkwd_ind_src_set() API configures the source of the backward indicator fields. Specifically the BDI/BEI/BIAE bits in the transmit framer of the specified channel. The API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:

The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID identifying the OPU framer channel. The source parameter chooses the transmit BDI/BEI/BIAE bits source from the following options of the g5_odu_oh_ins_src_t enumeration shown in Table 5 below.

entry.p: OH field source set by incoming OTN frames.
OH field source set by register forcing.
OH field source set by RCP module.
OH field source set by OHP module.
OH field source set by GCC module.
OH field source set by RX-Framer.

section.title: g5_api_otn_bdi_bei_biae_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_bdi_bei_biae_set() API configures the forced Backward Defect Indicator (BDI) or the Backward Error Indicator (BEI)/BIAE fields for a framer channel on the specified PM or TCM layer. Note that the value parameter is only written if the source of the STAT overhead field is the transmit framer as selected by the G5_ODU_OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE enumerator by the g5_api_otn_bkwd_ind_src_set() API. The g5_api_otn_bdi_bei_biae_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID identifying the OTN framer channel.

The layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_bdi_bei_biae_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the different SM/PM/TCM1-6 overhead field layers used in an OTN channel. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 above.
The bdi_set parameter chooses if the API call applies to BDI(TRUE), or BEI/BIAE(FALSE).
The value parameter is the 1-bit value to be inserted in the BDI field or the 4-bit value to be set to the BEI/BIAE field.

section.title: g5_api_otn_stat_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_stat_set() API configures the transmitted 3-bit status (STAT) overhead field. This API only applies to the transmit source side of the ODU framer channel. The receive accepted sink side is read-only and has no set API. This API applies to the SM, PM and TCM layers. Note that the value parameter is only written if the source of the STAT overhead field is the transmit framer as selected by the G5_ODU_OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE enumerator by the g5_api_otn_bkwd_ind_src_set() API. The g5_api_otn_stat_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID identifying the OTN framer channel.

The layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_stat_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the different SM/PM/TCM1-6 overhead field layers used in an OTN channel. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 above.
The value parameter is the 3-bit value to be inserted in the STAT field. The range is 0x0 - 0x7

section.title: g5_api_otn_tx_ftfl_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tx_ftfl_set() API sets the Transmit Fault Type & Fault Location(FTFL) overhead field of an ODUk framer channel. This API is used to support the G.709 legacy FTFL field in an ODU framer. The FTFL field can be passed through transparently, inserted through a register or though the OHP. This API is used for the first two options. The g5_api_ohp_cfg() and g5_api_ohp_chnl_set() APIs are used for FTFL insertion through the OHP.
The FTFL will update as per Table 6 below.

entry.p: Incoming ODUk OH FTFL value is transmitted on the ODUk OH.
The current FTFL register value will be inserted to ODUk OH.
FTFL value in 'ftfl_ptr' is written to the FTFL register.
If 'ins_src' was previously set to G5_ODU_OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE, the 'ftfl_ptr' value is transmitted on the ODUk OH.
If SRC_SET != OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE, then the value in 'ftfl_ptr' will not be transmitted on the ODUk OH.
FTFL value in 'ftfl_ptr' is written to the FTFL register and will be transmitted on the ODUk OH.

section.p: The g5_api_otn_tx_ftfl_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The action parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_ftfl_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_odu_oh_ins_act_t that represents the set of overhead insertion actions to perform (set source, set value or both). The action choices are shown in below.

entry.p: Set OH field value and source.

section.p: The ins_src parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_ftfl_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_odu_oh_ins_src_t that represents which module should alter the FTFL overhead field. Only G5_ODU_OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE will update the FTFL value on the ODUk OH. The ins_src choices are shown in Table 5 above.

The ftfl_field parameter the g5_api_otn_tx_ftfl_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_ftfl_oh_ins_t that represents the FTFL field direction (forward, backward, or both). The ftfl_field choices are shown in Table 8 below.

The ftfl_ptr parameter is defined by the g5_odu_ftfl_t * structure that represents the FTFL OH field value to be inserted in the ODU frame. The FTFL FFIF value is 1 byte, the FTFL FOIF value is 9 bytes, FTFL BFIF value is 1 byte and the FTFL BOIF value is 9 bytes.

section.title: g5_api_otn_tx_aps_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tx_aps_set() API sets the Transmit Automatic Protection Switching(APS) overhead field of an ODUCn/ODUk framer channel. This function is used to support the G.709 APS field in ODU framer. The APS field can be passed through transparently or inserted with a register. The g5_api_otn_tx_aps_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The ins_src parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_aps_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_odu_oh_ins_src_t that represents which module should alter the APS overhead field. Only G5_ODU_OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE will update the APS value on the ODUk OH. The ins_src choices are shown in Table 5 above.
The value parameter is the APS OH field value to be inserted in the ODU frame.

section.title: g5_api_otn_tx_exp_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tx_exp_set() API sets the Transmit Experimental(EXP) overhead field of an ODUk framer channel. This function is used to support the G.709 EXP field in ODU framer. The EXP field can be passed through transparently, inserted through register bits. The g5_api_otn_tx_exp_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The ins_src parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_exp_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_odu_oh_ins_src_t that represents which module should alter the EXP overhead field. Only G5_ODU_OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE will update the EXP value on the ODUk OH. The ins_src choices are shown in Table 5 above.

The exp parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_exp_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_oh_exp_t that identifies the EXP overhead field location in the ODUk. The enumerators for g5_otn_oh_exp_t are shown in g5_api_otn_tx_exp_set() below. EXP1, and EXP2 fields are 1 byte wide and EXP3 is 2 bytes wide.

entry.p: ODUk EXP byte in row 2 col 4.
ODUk EXP byte in row 2 col 14.
ODUk EXP 2 bytes in row 3 col 13-14.

section.p: The exp_data parameter is the EXP(i), where i = 1-3, OH field value to be inserted in the ODU frame.

section.title: g5_api_otn_tx_tcm_act_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tx_tcm_act_set() API sets the Transmit Tandem Connection Monitor Activation/Deactivation Control Channel(TCM_ACT) overhead field of an ODUk framer channel. This function is used to support the G.709 TCM_ACT field in ODU framer. The TCM_ACT field can be passed through transparently or inserted through register bits. The g5_api_otn_tx_tcm_act_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The ins_src parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_tcm_act_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_odu_oh_ins_src_t that represents which module should alter the TCM_ACT overhead field. Only G5_ODU_OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE will update the TCM_ACT value on the ODUk OH. The ins_src choices are shown in Table 5 above.
The tcm_act_data parameter is the TCM_ACT OH field value to be inserted in the ODU frame.

section.title: g5_api_otn_tx_gcc_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tx_gcc_set() API sets the GCC OH fields for the specified OTN channel. The GCC operation applies as defined in the G.709 standard. The GCC fields can be passed through transparently or inserted through register bits. The g5_api_otn_tx_gcc_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The ins_src parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_gcc_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_odu_oh_ins_src_t that represents which module should alter the GCC overhead fields. Only G5_ODU_OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE will update the GCC values on the ODUk OH. The ins_src choices are shown in Table 5 above.

The gcc parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_gcc_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_oh_gcc_t that represents the different GCC overhead field used in an OTN channel. The enumerators for g5_otn_oh_gcc_t are shown in g5_api_otn_tx_gcc_set() below.
The gcc_data parameter is the GCC OH field value to be inserted in the ODU frame.

section.title: g5_api_otn_tx_res_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tx_res_set() API sets the Reserved for future international standardization(RES) OH fields for the specified OTN channel. The RES operation applies as defined in the G.709 standard. The RES fields can be passed through transparently or inserted through register bits. The g5_api_otn_tx_res_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The ins_src parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_res_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_odu_oh_ins_src_t that represents which module should alter the RES overhead fields. Only G5_ODU_OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE will update the RES value on the ODUk OH. The ins_src choices are shown in Table 5 above.

The res parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_res_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_oh_res_t that represents the different RES overhead field used in an OTN channel. The enumerators for g5_otn_oh_res_t are shown in g5_api_otn_tx_gcc_set() below.

entry.p: OTUk RES byte in row 1 col 14.
ODUk RES byte in row 2 col 1-2.
ODUk RES byte in row 4 col 9-14.

section.p: The res_value(i)parameter, where i = 0-5, is the RES OH field value i to be inserted in the ODU frame.

section.title: g5_api_otn_tx_osmc_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tx_osmc_set() API sets the OSMC OH fields for the specified OTN channel. The OSMC OH field applies as defined in the G.709 standard. The OSMC OH field can be passed through transparently or inserted through register bits. The g5_api_otn_tx_osmc_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The ins_src parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_osmc_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_odu_oh_ins_src_t that represents which module should alter the RES overhead fields. Only G5_ODU_OH_INS_REGISTER_FORCE will update the OSMC OH field on the ODUk OH. The ins_src choices are shown in Table 5 above.
The osmc_data parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_osmc_set() API is the 8 bit OSMC OH field value to be inserted in the OTUk frame.

section.title: g5_api_otn_odu_bip8_invert_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_odu_bip8_invert_set() API is used to insert the inverted BIP-8 value into the PM BIP-8 and any operational TCMi BIP-8 Overhead field of the ODUk channel. When this function is called with enable == TRUE, the calculated BIP-8 for a single frame will be inverted and inserted to the BIP-8 overhead fields. The g5_api_otn_odu_bip8_invert_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The enable parameter the g5_api_otn_odu_bip8_invert_set() API is a boolean variable to indicate if inverted BIP-8 will be inserted. When set to TRUE, the calculated BIP-8 will be inverted and inserted into the PM and TCM BIP-8 overhead fields. When set to FALSE, the inverted BIP-8 will not be inserted.

section.title: g5_api_otn_delay_measure_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_delay_measure_set() API sets the device as a delay measure source or in feed through mode. The delay measure is based on the ODU framer channel and the PM/TCM layer specified. When enabled as a delay measure source the DMp/DMTx bit is toggled and sink waits for the value to be received. Otherwise, when enabled for feed through mode DMp/DMTx is passed through transparently from the source to the sink.The g5_api_otn_delay_measure_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_delay_measure_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the different SM/PM/TCM1-6 overhead field layers used in an OTN channel. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 above.

The source_mode parameter the g5_api_otn_delay_measure_set() API is a boolean variable representing the delay measure mode. A value of TRUE enables the device as a delay measure source and a value of FALSE enables the device in feed through mode where the delay measure is passed through transparently.
The value parameter of the g5_api_otn_delay_measure_set() API is the initial delay measurement value if source_mode is TRUE.

section.title: g5_api_otn_delay_measure_start()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_delay_measure_start() API starts a delay measure that was previously set up via the g5_api_otn_delay_measure_set() API. This API is only applicable is the g5_api_otn_delay_measure_set() API enabled the device as the source of delay measure. Otherwise the g5_api_otn_delay_measure_start() API has no effect. The g5_api_otn_delay_measure_start() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_delay_measure_start() API is defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the different SM/PM/TCM1-6 overhead field layers used in an OTN channel. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 above.

section.title: g5_api_otn_tim_det_mode_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tim_det_mode_set() API sets the dTIM detection mode for an OTU or ODU framer channel in the sink position. This API applies to all possible stages. If configured at the PM or TCM layer the operation occurs on the ODU framer. If configured at the SM layer then the operation occurs on OTU framer. The g5_api_otn_tim_det_mode_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_tim_det_mode_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the different SM/PM/TCM1-6 overhead field layers used in an OTN channel. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 above.

The mode parameter of the g5_api_otn_tim_det_mode_set() API is the TTI mismatch detection mode to be applied and is defined by the g5_otn_tim_det_mode_t enumeration with the values shown in Table 12 below.

entry.p: Expected SAPI field is used when determining the dTIM defect.
Expected SAPI field is used when determining the dTIM defect.
Both the expected SAPI and DAPI fields are used when determining the dTIM defect.

section.title: g5_api_otn_otu_conseq_act_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_otu_conseq_act_set() API enables or disables consequential action generation on an OTU4, OTU4+, or OTUCn channel when one or more defect is detected on the OTU layer of the incoming stream. The selected conseq_act will be generated upon detection of the defects selected through defect_bitmask input argument. When these defects are detected and the consequential action generation is enabled on these defects, the desired consequential action will be generated. The g5_api_otn_otu_conseq_act_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_otucn_group_config().

The conseq_act parameter of the g5_api_otn_otu_conseq_act_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_otu_conseq_act_t that represents the possible consequential actions on the OTU layer. The conseq_act choices are shown in Table 13 below.
The defect_bitmask parameter of the g5_api_otn_otu_conseq_act_set() API is a bit mask used to select the defects that contribute to generation of the consequential action selected by conseq_act.

li.p: Bit 3 - OTU_D_AIS: contributes to aBDI and aTSF
Bit 10 - OTU_CI_SSF: contributes to aBDI and aTSF
Bit 11 - OTU_AI_TSF: contributes to aSSF and aAIS
Bit 12 - OTU_AI_TSD: contributes to aSSD Or a pre-defined activation bit masks which set all relevant bits:

section.title: g5_api_otn_odu_framer_stg_conseq_act_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_odu_framer_stg_conseq_act_set() API enables or disables consequential action generation on an ODUk channel when one or more defect is detected. The selected conseq_act will be generated upon detection of the defects selected through defect_bitmask input argument. When these defects are detected and the consequential action generation is enabled on these defects, the desired consequential action will be generated. The g5_api_otn_odu_framer_stg_conseq_act_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the device instance. The framer_stg parameter is defined by the enumeration g5_odu_framer_stg_t representing the ODUk framer stage. The framer_stg choices are shown in Table 14 below.

entry.p: LINE side High Order ODUk framer.
High Order ODUk framer if no ODTUCn multiplexing is used. MO ODUk framer if ODTUCn multiplexing and 1 level of ODTUjk multiplexing is used. Low Order ODUk framer if ODTUCn multiplexing is used.
Last full framer before the OCPB. Low Order ODUk framer when ODTUjk multiplexing is used. Not used when ODTUCn multiplexing or no multiplexing is used.
TCM processor to source TCMs towards fabric and to sink TCMs from fabric.
TCM processor to source TCMs towards fabric and to sink TCMs from fabric.
CLIENT side High Order ODUk framer.

section.p: The defect parameter of the g5_api_otn_odu_framer_stg_conseq_act_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_odu_framer_defect_t that represents the possible consequential actions on the OTU layer. The defect choices are shown in Table 13 below.

entry.p: dAIS consequential action to aBDI and aTSF
dOCI consequential action to aBDI, aTSF, and aAIS
dLCK consequential action to aBDI, aTSF, and aAIS

section.p: The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_odu_framer_stg_conseq_act_set() API is a boolean variable to indicate if the selected defect will contribute to generation of consequential actions. When set to TRUE: Upon detection of the selected defect, consequential action will be generated. When set to FALSE: Upon detection of the selected defect, consequential action will not be generated.

section.title: g5_api_otn_pm_tcm_conseq_act_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_pm_tcm_conseq_act_set() API enables or disables consequential action generation on ODUP or ODUT layer of an ODUk channel upon detection of a defect. The g5_api_otn_pm_tcm_conseq_act_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The pm_tcm_layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_pm_tcm_conseq_act_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the PM or TCMi layer within the ODUk channel. Only PM, TCM1 - TCM6 and floating TCM, and PM_NIM layers are valid. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 above.

The conseq_act parameter of the g5_api_otn_pm_tcm_conseq_act_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_odu_pm_tcm_conseq_act_t that represents the possible consequential actions on the OTU layer. The conseq_act choices are shown in Table 13 below.

entry.p: Backward defects such as BDI, BIAE, or BEI do not contribute to generation of corresponding consequential action
AIS consequential action generation upon detection of a relevant defect
TSF consequential action generation upon detection of a relevant defect
TSD consequential action generation upon detection of a relevant defect

section.p: The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_pm_tcm_conseq_act_set() API is a boolean to indicate if the selected defect will contribute to generation of consequential actions. When set to TRUE: Upon detection of the selected defect, consequential action will be generated. When set to FALSE: Upon detection of the selected defect, consequential action will not be generated.

section.title: g5_api_otn_tcm_ltc_act_enbl_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tcm_ltc_act_enbl_set() API sets MI_LTCAct_Enable as defined in G.798. This function enables or disables consequential action generation on a selected TCM layer of an ODUk channel upon detection of dLTC. The g5_api_otn_tcm_ltc_act_enbl_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The tcm_layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_tcm_ltc_act_enbl_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the TCMi layer within the ODUk channel. Only TCM1-TCM6 and floating TCM layer are valid. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 above.

The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_tcm_ltc_act_enbl_set() API is a boolean to set MI_LTCAct_Enable as defined in G.798. It indicates if dLTC contributes to the generation of a consequential action. When set to TRUE: dLTC contributes to consequential action generation. When set to FALSE: dLTC does not contribute to consequential action generation.

section.title: g5_api_otn_tcm_tim_act_dis_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tcm_tim_act_dis_set() API sets MI_TIMActDis as defined in G.798. This function enables or disables consequential action generation on ODUP or ODUT layer of an ODUk channel upon detection of dTIM. The g5_api_otn_tcm_tim_act_dis_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The tcm_layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_tcm_tim_act_dis_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the PM or TCMi layer within the ODUk channel. Only PM, TCM1 - TCM6 and floating TCM, and PM_NIM layers are valid. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 above.

The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_tcm_tim_act_dis_set() API is a boolean to set TIMActDis as defined in G.798. Indicates if dTIM contributes to the generation of a consequential action. When set to TRUE: dTIM contributes to consequential action generation. When set to FALSE: dTIM does not contribute to consequential action generation.

section.title: g5_api_otn_tcm_ais_act_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tcm_ais_act_set() API enables or disables aAIS consequential action on an operational TCM layer of an ODUk channel to be generated downstream to ODUP layer. The g5_api_otn_tcm_ais_act_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The tcm_layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_tcm_ais_act_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the TCMi layer within the ODUk channel. Only TCM1-TCM6 and floating TCM layer are valid. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 above.

The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_tcm_ais_act_set() API is a boolean to set the AIS. When set to TRUE: aAIS consequential action is generated downstream. When set to FALSE: aAIS consequential action is not generated downstream.

section.title: g5_api_otn_odu_conseq_act_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_odu_conseq_act_set() API enables or disables consequential action generation on an ODUk channel upon detection of a selected defect. The g5_api_otn_odu_conseq_act_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The defect parameter of the g5_api_otn_odu_conseq_act_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_odu_chnl_defect_t that represents the possible defects that results in a consequential action. The layer choices are shown in Table 17 below.

entry.p: Ingress SF results in egress SSF.
dLOFLOM causes ODU-AIS to be inserted in the ODUk channel.

dMSIM results in egress SSF. This is only used in g5_host_otn_oducn_conseq_act_set(). In order to generate SSF from incoming dMSIM on ODUk channel In order to generate SSF from incoming dMSIM on ODUk channel in ODTUjk demultiplexer, g5_host_otn_odu_framer_stg_msim_act_set().

section.p: The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_odu_conseq_act_set() API is a boolean to indicate if the selected defect will contribute to generation of consequential actions. When set to TRUE: Upon detection of the selected defect, consequential action will be generated. When set to FALSE: Upon detection of the selected defect, consequential action will not be generated.

section.title: g5_api_otn_oducn_conseq_act_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_oducn_conseq_act_set() API enables or disables consequential action generation on an ODUCn channel upon detection of a selected defect being present on one or more of its member ODUC channel. The g5_api_otn_oducn_conseq_act_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter identifies the ODUCn channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_oducn_group_prov().

The oduc_members_mask parameter of the g5_api_otn_oducn_conseq_act_set() API is a bit mask used to hold 6 individual ODUC members of the ODUCn group. This bit mask indicates which ODUC member channels within the ODUCn group will contribute to the consequential action generation. Up to 6 members can be selected at one time. The ODUC member on the bit location set in this bit mask corresponds to the ODUC #(bit location + 1) member of the ODUCn group.

The defect parameter of the g5_api_otn_oducn_conseq_act_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_odu_chnl_defect_t that represents the possible defects that results in a consequential action. The layer choices are shown in Table 17 above.

The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_oducn_conseq_act_set() API is a boolean to indicate if the selected defect will contribute to generation of consequential actions. When set to TRUE: Upon detection of the selected defect, consequential action will be generated. When set to FALSE: Upon detection of the selected defect, consequential action will not be generated.

section.title: g5_api_otn_odu_framer_stg_msim_act_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_odu_framer_stg_msim_act_set() API enables or disables SSF generation upon dMSIM detection on all ODUk channels of the selected ODU framer stage. The setting selected in this function will apply to all ODUk channels within he ODUk framer. Per tributary port selection for dMSIM to SSF control in ODTUjk is not supported. The g5_api_otn_odu_framer_stg_msim_act_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the device instance. The framer_stg parameter is defined by the enumeration g5_odu_framer_stg_t representing the ODUk framer stage. The framer_stg choices are shown in Table 14 above.

The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_odu_framer_stg_msim_act_set() API is a boolean to indicate if the selected defect will contribute to generation of consequential actions. When set to TRUE: Upon detection of the selected defect, consequential action will be generated. When set to FALSE: Upon detection of the selected defect, consequential action will not be generated.

section.title: g5_api_otn_odu_force_iae_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_odu_force_iae_set() API forces an IAE into the ODU overhead of all operational TCM layers provisioned on the ODUk channel. When IAE is forced, a '010' pattern will be inserted in the TCM STAT overhead field for 16 multi-frames. The g5_api_otn_odu_force_iae_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_odu_force_iae_set() API is a boolean to indicate if an IAE will be forced. When set to TRUE: STAT field of all operational TCM layers of the chnl_id will have 010 pattern inserted. When set to FALSE: No forcing of IAE will occur on the STAT field of the TCM layers of the chnl_id.

section.title: g5_api_otn_odu_auto_iae_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_odu_auto_iae_set() API is used to enable or disable the automatic insertion of IAE into the STAT overhead field of all operational TCM layers of the ODUk channel. The g5_api_otn_odu_auto_iae_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_odu_auto_iae_set() API is a boolean to indicate if automatic insertion of IAE is used. When set to TRUE: Automatic insertion of IAE into the TCM layer's STAT overhead is enabled. When set to FALSE: Automatic insertion of IAE into the TCM layer's STAT overhead field is disabled.

section.title: g5_api_otn_maint_sig_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_maint_sig_set() API inserts or removes a maintenance signal on an OTUk, ODUP, or ODUT layer. This function is used to force a maintenance signal on transmit data stream or receive data stream. In order to remove a maintenance signal, call this function with enable set to FALSE. The g5_api_otn_maint_sig_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The layer parameter of the g5_api_otn_maint_sig_set() API is defined by the enumeration g5_otn_layer_t that represents the different SM/PM/TCM1-6 overhead field layers used in an OTN channel. The layer choices are shown in Table 3 above.
The direction parameter of the g5_api_otn_maint_sig_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_direction_t that represents the direction being set. The direction choices are shown in Table 4 above.

The maint_sig parameter of the g5_api_otn_maint_sig_set() API is the available maintenance signal types to be forced on OTUk, ODUk, or ODUT layer and is defined by the g5_otn_maint_sig_t enumeration with the values shown in Table 18 below.

The fabric_framer_flag parameter used when the chnl_id refers to a segment with two framer stages (and is ignored otherwise): When set to TRUE, the Stage 3B or Stage 4 framers to/from the fabric which are appropriate for the segment are selected. When set to FALSE the Stage1/2/3A/N framer is selected. The following segments have multiple framer stages:

li.p: LINEOTN OEO and SYSOTN OEO: OTUCN_GROUP_SEGMENT

section.title: g5_api_otn_null_sig_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_null_sig_set() API inserts or removes a NULL signal on the OPU payload in transmit direction. The g5_api_otn_null_sig_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter identifies the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_odu_mux_cfg() or MAPOTN channel ID. MAPOTN channel ID is a slave channel ID of an Interlaken or Ethernet channel based on the application type.

The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_null_sig_set() API is a boolean to indicate if NULL signal is mapped to the OPU payload. When set to TRUE: NULL signal is inserted. When set to FALSE: NULL signal is not inserted.

section.title: g5_api_otn_opu_csf_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_opu_csf_set() API configures OPU-CSF bit on the OPU overhead. When OPU-CSF bit set to be enabled, it will write 1 to the OPU-CSF bit of the PSI byte[2] to indicate the signal fail status of the client. The g5_api_otn_opu_csf_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter identifies the MAPOTN channel ID. MAPOTN channel ID is a slave channel ID of an Interlaken or Ethernet channel based on the application type.

The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_opu_csf_set() API is a boolean to indicate if signal fail status of the client signal. When set to TRUE: There is a client signal fail. When set to FALSE: There is no client signal fail.

section.title: g5_api_otn_otu_passthru_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_otu_passthru_set() API configures an OTUk or an OTUCn channel in pass through mode in sink or source direction. This function is used for LINEOTN or SYSOTN channels. When an OTUCn channel is configured in pass through mode, all OTUC member of the OTUCn group will be in pass through mode. When an OTUk or an OTUCn channel is put in passthrough mode, the following consequential actions are disabled:
The g5_api_otn_otu_passthru_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter identifies the OTUk channel that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or the OTUCn group channel that was provisioned with g5_api_otucn_group_prov().

The direction parameter of the g5_api_otn_otu_passthru_set() API defined by the enumeration g5_otn_direction_t that represents the direction being set. The direction choices are shown in Table 4 above.

The enable parameter of the g5_api_otn_otu_passthru_set() API is a boolean to indicate if the OTUk or OTUCn channel is in passthru mode. When set to TRUE: OTUk/OTUCn channel is in passthru mode. When set to FALSE: OTUk/OTUCn channel is not in passthru mode.

section.title: g5_api_gcc_chnl_cfg()
section.p: The g5_api_gcc_chnl_cfg() API enables insertion/extract of GCC0, GCC1, or GCC2 fields between the framer referenced by the channel and the GCC port identified by the framer type. The framer should have been activated on the OHP associated with the GCC port referenced by the channel id. If the channel id is a High Order then all three GCC fields can be enabled. However, if a lower order channel then only GCC1 and/or GCC2 apply. The g5_api_gcc_chnl_cfg() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

The gcc0_enable parameter of the g5_api_gcc_chnl_cfg() API is a boolean to enable or disable extraction/insertion for GCC0 field. The gcc1_enable parameter of the g5_api_gcc_chnl_cfg() API is a boolean to enable or disable extraction/insertion for GCC1 field. The gcc2_enable parameter of the g5_api_gcc_chnl_cfg() API is a boolean to enable or disable extraction/insertion for GCC2 field.

section.title: g5_api_ohp_chnl_set()
section.p: The g5_api_ohp_chnl_set() API enables or disables the OHP extraction and/or insertion mask for a particular channel. This API can be used to set insertion only, extraction only or both. The ODUk overhead data consists of 4 rows of 16 bytes each for a total of 64 bytes (16 32-bit words). The OHP can extract all overhead bytes except the BIP-8 from PM/TCMs and JC1, JC2 and JC3. OTUk overhead (Row 1, bytes 7-14) are only extracted by stage 1 framers. OHP can insert all bytes except the BIP-8 bytes from SM. PM and TCMs. OTUk overhead (Row 1, bytes 1-14) can only be inserted by stage 1 framers.

An OHP can insert/extract only 10 of the possible 16 words which is why a 16 element is used to specified the 10 words the OHP will insert/ extract. As specified a word is 4 bytes. OHP inserts/extract in bye granularity however it is not required to set all 4 bytes within a word. A 40 bit segment (5 bytes) precedes the 8 frames an OHP will insert to or extract from which specifies which bytes in the possible 40 bytes (10 words) OHP will access in those 8 frames. The break down of the Overhead words are shown in Table 19 below.
The g5_api_ohp_chnl_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODU framer channel for stage 1, N, 2, 3A, 3B, o4 4 or the Flex E or Flex 0 group channel ID.

The extract_mask parameter of the g5_api_ohp_chnl_set() API is a 16 bit mask with 10 bits set to be extracted. All bits should be set to 0 if extract mask is not to be set. 0 or 10 bits set is valid. Anything else is an error. The insert_mask is a 16 bit mask with up to 10 bits corresponding to to 10 of the 16 overhead words to be inserted. If no insertion is to be performed then the mask should be 0.. An error is returned if more than 10 bits are set.

The enable parameter of the g5_api_ohp_chnl_set() API enables the insertion/extraction for the channel id framer in the Tx and Rx direction based on the insert or extract mask values. A value of FALSE disables insertion or extraction based on the mask setting where as TRUE enables it.

section.title: g5_api_otn_prbs_en_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_prbs_en_set() API enables or disables the PRBS function mapped into ODUk. Please note that PRBS is generated in transmitted direction and monitored in received direction. The g5_api_ohp_chnl_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().
The prbs_chid parameter of the g5_api_otn_prbs_en_set() API is the PRBS channel ID that carries the PRBS pattern. The valid range is 0 - 11.
The prbs_mode parameter of the g5_api_otn_prbs_en_set() API selects the PRBS mode as defined by the enumeration g5_prbs_pattern_t as shown in Table 20 below.
The so_prbs_en parameter of the g5_api_otn_prbs_en_set() API is used to enable the PRBS function at the source. The sk_prbs_en parameter is used to enable the PRBS function at the sink.

section.title: g5_api_otn_prbs_thresh_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_prbs_thresh_set() API configures the defect threshold count for the given PRBS channel. If the bit error rate goes over the programmed threshold in a given LCLK one second interval, the PRBS monitor will enter out of lock state. Changing this configuration will affect all channels. The g5_api_otn_prbs_thresh_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().
The threshold parameter of the g5_api_otn_prbs_thresh_set() API is the defect threshold count. Valid range: 0 - 0x7FFFFFFFF.
The reseed_thresh parameter of the g5_api_otn_prbs_thresh_set() API is the number of bit errors detected before PRBS monitor reseed. The reference value is set to 0xF0.
The reseed_interval parameter of the g5_api_otn_prbs_thresh_set() API is the number of cycles between re-seed attempts. The reference value is set to 0x180.

section.title: g5_api_otn_prbs_err_insert()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_prbs_err_insert() API is used for PRBS single error insertion. Please note that PRBS is generated in transmitted direction and monitored in received direction. The g5_api_otn_prbs_err_insert() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().

section.title: g5_api_lineotn_bergen_set()
section.p: The g5_api_lineotn_bergen_set() API enables and disables the LINEOTN or SYSOTN Bit Error Generator on 32-bit interfaces (BERGEN32). Bit Error Rate Generator (BERGEN) blocks are available on each 10G, 32-bit line-side interface. These blocks are typically used to evaluate FEC performance. This function configures BERGEN for one or multiple lane interfaces. It is possible to configure multiple lanes of a SERDES port with different BERGEN configurations by calling this function multiple times. The g5_api_lineotn_bergen_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().
The logical_lanes_msk parameter of the g5_api_lineotn_bergen_set() API is the logical lane mask associated to the aggregated port. Use 0x3FF to enable all lanes for an OTU4 stream.
The enable parameter of the g5_api_lineotn_bergen_set() API is a boolean used to enable BERGENs on specific lanes.

The error_rate parameter of the g5_api_lineotn_bergen_set() API is bit error density. You can specify a value between 0 and 1.0. This field has a precision of 24 bits use a UINT32 which acts as a Q024 representation for 0.0 to 1.0 so that means that 0x00FF:FFFF is basically 1.0 and 0x0000:0001 is the smallest enabled value of 1/0xff:fffff

The ringosc_enable parameter of the g5_api_lineotn_bergen_set() API enables or disables the BERGEN Ring Oscillator. The 32 bit Bit Error Rate Generator (BERGEN32) blocks have the ability to use clocks created by free running ring oscillators to create asynchronous events that better randomize the distribution of bit errors inserted in the transmit line data.
The bergen_mode parameter of the g5_api_lineotn_bergen_set() API is the error insertion mode as defined by the g5_lineotn_bergen_err_mode enumeration shown in Table 21 below.

entry.p: LINE_OTN_BERGEN_NORMAL - Inverts the input bit in order to insert an erroneous bit.
Inverts the input bit only if the input bit is 1 in order to insert an erroneous 0.
In order to insert an erroneous 1. Inverts the input bit only if the input bit is 0

section.title: g5_api_otn_tx_otu_oh_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_tx_otu_oh_set() API enables or disables BIP8/BEI/BIAE/IAE/BDI/MFAS overhead insertion in OTU layer. The g5_api_otn_tx_otu_oh_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the OTUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov().
The oh_field parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_otu_oh_set() API is the error insertion mode as defined by the g5_oh_field_t enumeration shown in Table 22 below.
The oh_value parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_otu_oh_set() API is the value to be transmitted in the overhead bytes.
The oh_type parameter of the g5_api_otn_tx_otu_oh_set() API is the error insertion mode as defined by the g5_oh_inst_type_t enumeration shown in Table 23 below.

entry.p: Calculated BIP8 or OTU_Sk consequent action value is inserted. Note: For MFAS field, it is inserted via a freewheeling counter based on the upstream MFAS.

section.title: g5_api_otn_deg_mode_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_deg_mode_set() API configures the dDEG detection mode for hardware calculation or firmware calculation. The g5_api_otn_deg_mode_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance.
The deg_mode parameter of the g5_api_otn_deg_mode_set() API is the error insertion mode as defined by the g5_otn_ddeg_mode_t enumeration shown in Table 24 below.

entry.p: dDEG report will be issued using a 1 second monitoring interval as defined in G.806.
This mode represents ENHANCED + BURSTY dDEG collection. A dDEG report will be issued for both the G.806 dDEG (1s interval) and the enhanced dDEG configurable to 10/100 ms intervals.

section.title: g5_api_otn_deg_para_set()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_deg_para_set() API configures the dDEG detection mode: hardware calculation or firmware calculation. The g5_api_otn_deg_para_set() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().
The seg_id parameter of the g5_api_otn_deg_para_set() API is the OTN segment type as defined by the g5_otn_seg_t enumeration shown in Table 25 below.

entry.p: PM NIM segment with TCM pool ID (only valid for sink)

section.p: The deg_th parameter of the g5_api_otn_deg_para_set() API is the error block count threshold. The range is 0 < DEGTHR <= number of blocks. The deg_m parameter is the dDEG monitoring interval. The range is from 2 to 10.

section.title: g5_api_otn_cfg_get()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_cfg_get() API returns the complete channel configuration information for the chnl_id specified. The g5_api_otn_cfg_get() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The g5_api_otn_cfg_get() API returns the otn_cfg_ptr pointer with the structure containing the OTN configuration info.
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter is the ODUk channel ID that was provisioned with g5_api_otn_prov() or g5_api_odu_mux_cfg().
The otn_cfg_ptr parameter of the g5_api_otn_cfg_get() API is the OTN segment type as defined by the g5_otn_cfg_get_t * structure shown in below.

entry.p: g5_api_otn_rx_gcc_get()? - only lower 16 valid - status value
g5_api_otn_rx_gcc_get()? - only lower 16 valid - status value

section.p: The mode parameter of the g5_api_otn_cfg_get() API is the level of detail included in the returned data and is defined by the enumeration g5_runtime_get_mode_t shown below:

li.p: G5_API_RUNTIME_GET_MODE_CFG = 0x1: configuration values set by set() functions
G5_API_RUNTIME_GET_MODE_STATUS = 0x2: status values from datapath. Eg. aps_rx, exp1, exp2, exp3, gcc_rx_data, res_rx_value, msi_rx_value etc.
G5_API_RUNTIME_GET_MODE_DEBUG = 0x4: Deep debug information (large): tti_tx, tti_rx_exp, msi_tx_value.

section.title: g5_api_gcc_chnl_get()
section.p: The g5_api_gcc_chnl_get() API returns the complete channel configuration information for the chnl_id specified. The g5_api_gcc_chnl_get() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:

The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter identifies the MAPOTN channel ID. MAPOTN channel ID is a slave channel ID of an Interlaken or Ethernet channel based on the application type.
The g5_api_gcc_chnl_get() API returns the following pointers.
The gcc0-2_enable_ptr returns the enable flag for the GCC0, GCC1 and GCC2 fields.

section.title: g5_api_otn_fec_mode_get()
section.p: The g5_api_otn_fec_mode_get() API returns the current FEC mode setting for the specified High Order OTN channel id and the error rate percentage. Get function are currently disabled if batch mode is on. Returns an error if either batch mode is enabled or if the request could not be sent to the device. Otherwise returns the g5_otn_fec_mode_t field and the error rate. The g5_api_otn_fec_mode_get() API has the following parameters and associated enumerations or structures:
The device_id parameter is the device instance. The chnl_id parameter identifies the channel id used when the High Order OTN channel was provisioned. References the OTU side of the segment.
The g5_api_otn_fec_mode_get() API returns the following pointers.
The mode_ptr returns the FEC mode as defined by g5_otn_fec_mode_t . The rate_ptr returns the FEC error rate as a number from 0 to 10000000 that represents 0 to 0.000001% error rate.
